DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether a smoking cessation telephone care coordination program is effective and feasible in VA Mental Health Clinics.
DOC.brief_title: Telephone Care Coordination for Smokers in VA Mental Health Clinics
DOC.detailed_description: Smoking is the leading preventable cause of death in the United States and is a particular problem among VA users and among persons with a diagnosed mental illness. The prevalence of smoking among VA mental health patients has remained high, in part because smoking cessation treatment rates have remained low. Telephone-based counseling represents the most feasible approach to increasing smoking cessation treatment among VA patients. The approach used in this study has been used very effectively in a primary care-based population that includes a large percentage of mental health patients. This project would target the program specifically at patients seen in VA Mental Health Clinics.
DOC.criteria: Smokers who are referred from Mental Health Clinics in VA VISNs 1 and 3. Patients must have access to a telephone and a regular mailing address. No access to a telephone no mailing address not receiving care from a VISN 1 or VISN 3 Mental Health provider
